newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk MPs vote against impeaching Deputy PM Ciller.
newsitem.headline: Turk MPs vote against impeaching Deputy PM Ciller.

text.p: Turkish MPs voted on Wednesday against sending Deputy Prime Minister Tansu Ciller to the Supreme Court on a corruption charge relating to the source of her considerable personal wealth.
Deputy Speaker Kamer Genc said deputies voted 270 to 263 against impeaching Ciller on allegations that her wealth was a result of illegal enrichment.
"Hence it is no longer necessary to send former prime minster Tansu Ciller to the Supreme Court," Genc said after announcing the result.
Impeachment of Ciller in the vote, the third directed at her this week, would have been a serious blow to Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan's Islamist-led government.

On Tuesday, Ciller comfortably won votes on two corruption charges relating to the sale of state-owned car maker TOFAS and to the electricity company TEDAS during her time as prime minister between 1993 and 1996.
The government must next week deal with opposition censure motions accusing the coalition of threatening Turkey's secular system with plans to increase the role of Islam in public life.
